intro: Anchusa bracteolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bugloss, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Anchusa bracteolata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
